column1: 新北市三峽區學府路132號5樓之4

Paul Anderson你因為在103年05月27日造訪新北市鶯歌博物館時，拿了原告陳小倩的雨傘，因為此行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，當你還傘時，當場被陳小倩人、傘具獲，因此她提出告訴。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎? 待會我也會詢問原告，聽聽她陳述當天發生的經過，雙方明白程序嗎?

The incident happened on May 22nd, 2014, and the defendant, Mr. Anderson, took the umbrella of Ms.陳小倩, and the incident happened in Yingge Ceramics Museum. This incident happened without asking for the permission from the plaintiff. When the defendant returned the umbrella, Ms.陳小倩, found that behavior right on the scene. Therefore, the plaintiff filed this case. In today’s procedure, we would like to understand the details on that day. Please explain regarding my questions to help the prosecutor what happened on that day. Do you understand? And later, we will ask the plaintiff about what happened on that day. Do you understand the procedure?

column3: The user mistranslated the date of the incident as May 22nd, 2014 instead of May 27th, 2014.
The user omitted the fact that the defendant took the umbrella without the plaintiff's permission.
The user omitted the location of the incident, which is Yingge Ceramics Museum.
The user omitted the fact that the plaintiff filed the case as a result of the incident.
The user omitted the fact that the plaintiff found out about the defendant's behavior when he returned the umbrella.

column1: She yelled at me, saying that I stole her umbrella. I tried to tell her that I must have taken the wrong one. I did not steal her umbrella. I tried to apologize to her, but she wouldn’t listen.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
那天我跟同學一起去博物館看一個展覽。當我們看完展覽，有兩位同學說他們很餓。所以我們決定去外面買東西吃，也許是在外面找個地方吃晚餐。當我要離開博物館時，外面正在下雨。我沒有帶傘，所以我想要跟同學借一把傘。因為我有點高，又有點壯，就決定跟我ㄧ個同學Adam借把傘。他的體型跟我差不多。所以我從傘架中拿了一把傘。我跟我的老師，還有幾位同學一起去買麵包。我們回來的時候，陳小姐就看到我，並對我大叫。

column3: The word order in the sentence '所以我們決定去外面買東西吃' is incorrect. It should be '所以我們決定去外面吃東西'.
The verb '看' in the sentence '那天我跟同學一起去博物館看一個展覽' should agree with the subject '我們', so it should be '看了' instead of '看'.
The verb '回來' in the sentence '我們回來的時候' should be in the past tense, so it should be '回來了' instead of '回來'.
The pronoun '我' in the sentence '所以我們決定去外面買東西吃' should be '我們' to match the plural subject.
The user's translation omits the detail that the classmates were hungry, which is mentioned in the original text.
The user's translation omits the detail that the user planned to borrow an umbrella from their classmates.
The user's translation omits the detail that the user went to buy bread with their professor and two other friends.

我那天去鶯歌博物館，當時在下雨，我在進館時，把雨傘放在外面的傘架上，可是當我出來時，傘不見了，我請館方人員幫我找，後來就看到這個外國人把傘拿回來放，當我發現他拿的傘就是我失竊的傘時，我很生氣，有質問他為何要拿我的傘? 難道不知道外面在下雨嗎?怎麼會有人那麼沒有公德心呢?

I went to Yingge Ceramics Museum on that day, and it was raining. When I entered the museum, I put my umbrella in the umbrella rack. However, when I came out form the museum, I found that my umbrella was missing. I asked the staff in the museum to help me find the umbrella, but I later saw putting my umbrella back. When I found that the umbrella he took was actually mine, I was actually very angry, and I asked him why he had taken my umbrella. It was raining at that time. How could he do that?

Paul Anderson你因為在103年05月27日造訪新北市鶯歌博物館時，拿了原告陳小倩的雨傘，因為此行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，當你還傘時，當場被陳小倩人、傘具獲，因此她提出告訴。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎? 待會我也會詢問原告，聽聽她陳述當天發生的經過，雙方明白程序嗎?

The defendant Paul Anderson was accused of stealing the umbrella of Shiao Chien Chen in Yingge Ceramics Museum. This action wasn’t aware by the plaintiff. When you were about to return the umbrella, you were caught by Shiao Chien Chen with the umbrella. Therefore she decided to file this case. Today’s procedure is mainly set to figure out what happened on this day. Please answer my questions so that we can figure out what happened on this day. Do you understand? Later on, I will also question the plaintiff. Do both parties understand the procedure?

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
那天我跟我跟我同學去博物館看展覽。當我們看完的時候，我的兩個同學說他們很餓。所以我們決定去外面找地方吃東西。可是當我們要離開的時候，外面在下雨。我沒有帶傘，所以想跟我同學借把傘。但是我很高又很壯，我決定跟我朋友亞當借傘。她的身形跟我很像。所以我從傘架上拿了他的傘。我跟教授一起去買一些麵包。當我們回來的時候，陳小姐就開始對我大吼大叫。

Paul Anderson你因為在103年05月27日造訪新北市鶯歌博物館時，拿了原告陳小倩的雨傘，因為此行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，當你還傘時，當場被陳小倩人、傘具獲，因此她提出告訴。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎? 待會我也會詢問原告，聽聽她陳述當天發生的經過，雙方明白程序嗎?

The incident happened in 2014, May 27th and the defendant, Paul Anderson took the plaintiff’s umbrella in Yingge Ceramic Museum. The incidient happened without notifying the plaintiff. When the defendant tried to return the umbrella, he was caught by plaintiff on the spot. Therefore, she filed this case. The procedure of today is to understand what happened at that day. Please answer the question I ask so that we could know the whole procedure Later, I will ask the plaintiff about what happened at that day, do both sides understand?

The user omitted the mention of New Taipei City in the translation.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
那天，我和我同學來這邊看一個展覽，當看完這個展覽之後，有兩同學說他們很餓，所以我們就一起出去買點吃的，然後找個地方吃晚餐，當我要準備離開博物館的時候，發現外面在下雨，因為我沒有帶傘，所以想跟其中一個同學借一把傘。因為我人高又魁，所以想跟其中一個叫亞當的同學借傘，我跟他體型比較像。所以就從傘架中拿了一把傘。我買一些麵包給同學和教授，當我回來的時候，就看到陳小姐對我大聲怒喊著。

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
事發當天我和一些同學去看展覽。當我們看完展覽的時候，我有幾個同學說他們肚子餓。因此我們決定走出博物館找些東西吃，甚至是吃晚餐。當我要離開的時候，發現正在下雨。我忘記帶傘了，所以想要和我同學借。因為我長得比較高大，所以我想要跟亞當，我的同學，借傘，他的體型和我比較相近，所以我就從傘架拿了一支傘。我就和我的老師和同學一起去買麵包了。當我們回來的時候就是事發的經過了，陳小姐就開始對我大喊。

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

那天我和我的同學去博物館看一場展覽。當我們看完展覽的時候，我的兩個同學說他們很餓，所以我們決定離開，去看看有沒有甚麼東西可以吃，所以我們就離開去找餐廳。當我離開博物館時，我發現下雨，我沒有帶傘，所以我打算跟我的同學借一把。因為我的體格比較高，所以我決定跟我的朋友Adam借傘。他和我的體格相近。然後我就雨傘架拿了一把雨傘。然後我打算去買一些麵包給我的教授和朋。當我們回來時，陳小姐看到我就對我大吼大叫。

The verb '看看' (to see) should agree with the plural subject '我們' (we), so it should be '所以我們決定離開，去看看有沒有甚麼東西可以吃' (So we decided to leave, to see if there are anything to eat).

Pronoun error in the sentence '所以我打算跟我的同學借一把' (So I planned to borrow one from my classmates). The pronoun '我的同學' (my classmates) should be in the possessive form, so it should be '所以我打算跟我的同學們借一把' (So I planned to borrow one from my classmates).

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

Paul Anderson你因為在103年05月27日造訪新北市鶯歌博物館時，拿了原告陳小倩的雨傘，因為此行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，當你還傘時，當場被陳小倩人、傘具獲，因此她提出告訴。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎? 待會我也會詢問原告，聽聽她陳述當天發生的經過，雙方明白程序嗎?

The incident happened on May 27th ,2014. At Yingge Ceramics Museum. The defendant took the plaintiff Chen Xiao Chen’s umbrella. Because the behavior happened without the plaintiff’s notice, when you returned the umbrella, Miss Chen found you and the umbrella. She filed the case. Today’s procedure is mainly trying to understand what happened on that day. Please answer my questions and elaborate it so the police will understand what happened. Later I will ask the plaintiff some questions. Do the both party understand the procedure?

column3: The word order in the sentence 'The incident happened on May 27th ,2014' is incorrect. It should be 'The incident happened on May 27th, 2014.'
The translation of '新北市鶯歌博物館' as 'Yingge Ceramics Museum' is incorrect. It should be 'Yingge Museum of Ceramics'.
The translation omits the information that the defendant took the plaintiff's umbrella without her notice.
The translation omits the information that Miss Chen found the defendant and the umbrella when he returned it.
The translation omits the information that Miss Chen filed a case against the defendant.
The translation omits the information that the purpose of today's procedure is to understand what happened on that day.
The translation omits the information that the assistant will ask the plaintiff some questions later.
The translation omits the information that the assistant wants to ensure that both parties understand the procedure.

column1: She yelled at me, saying that I stole her umbrella. I tried to tell her that I must have taken the wrong one. I did not steal her umbrella. I tried to apologize to her, but she wouldn’t listen.
她對我大叫，說我偷了她的傘，我試著告訴她我一定是拿錯了， 我並沒有偷， 我試著跟他道歉，但她不聽

column3: The word order in the sentence "我試著跟他道歉" is incorrect. It should be "我試著跟她道歉" to match the gender of the person being apologized to.
The user omitted the pronoun "I" in the sentence "我試著告訴她我一定是拿錯了". It should be "我試著告訴她我一定是拿錯了" to indicate that the user is the one who took the wrong umbrella.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
那天，我跟一些同學去博物館看展， 我們看完時，有兩個同學說他們餓了，所以我們決定出去買一些東西，甚至去找吃晚餐的地方，當我們要離開博物館時，我發現下雨了，我沒有帶傘，所以決定跟我同學借，因為我比較高大，我決定跟亞當借傘，他的身型跟我比較像， 我從傘架拿了一把傘，我跟兩個同學還有教授去買了一些麵包 ，我們回來的時候就是陳小姐對我大叫的時候

The user's translation omits the important detail that the professor and classmates were with the user when they came out from the museum. The correct translation should include this detail.

I tried to return Ms. Chen her umbrella but she wouldn’t take it. I tried to apologize to her but she wouldn’t listen to me, either. Perhaps my professor and my friends will be able to prove what I have said today is the truth.

When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

那天我是跟同學去鶯歌陶瓷博物館看展覽，當我們看完最後一個展物的時候，其中兩個同學跟我說他們很餓，所以我們就打算出去找一些吃的，然後去吃晚餐。當時，當我要走出去覓食的時候，我發現外面下雨了。因為我沒有帶傘，所以我就想跟其中一個同學借傘。因為我長得比較高、比較大一隻，我就想跟亞登借傘，因為他的體型跟我比較像，所以我就跟他借傘。然後我就從架上拿了一把傘，我就跟我的一位教授跟其他兩位同學出去買一些麵包。那當我回來的時候我把傘歸還時，陳小姐就對我大吼了，這就是當時的狀況。

The incident happened on may 27, 2018. Paul Anderson, you steal Ms. Chen’s umbrella in Yingge Ceramics Museum, and was found by 小倩陳 with the umbrella. In today’s procedure, we will ask question about what happened that day. So please answer the questions in order to let us know what happened. Later, I will ask the plaintiff, do the both party understand?

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
那天我和我同學一起去鶯歌陶瓷博物館看展覽，看完展覽之後兩個我的同學跟我說他們很餓，於是我們想出去找地方買晚餐。當我們從博物館出來時，我發現開始下雨了，而我沒有帶傘，所以我想向我同學借傘，因為我的體型比較高大，所以我決定向Adam借傘，他的體型跟我比較相近，於是我從傘架上拿了傘，跟著教授和我同學們去買麵包，當我回來時，陳小姐就在那對我大吼。

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

那個時候我和我的同學去陶瓷博物館看展覽，那個時候看完展覽的一些東西之後，我的兩個同學就說他們餓了，所以我們決定去外面買東西，我們還想要在外面找個地方吃晚餐。正當我要離開博物館的時候，我發現外面正在下雨，但是我發現我沒有帶傘，然後我就決定我要跟我同學借傘，因為我比較高，看起來比較大隻，所以我決定要跟我的同學艾迪借傘，因為他也比較大隻，跟我的身型比較接近。然後我就從架上拿走了一把傘，然後跟我的一個教授跟兩個同學出去買麵包，當我回來的時候，我就看到陳小姐在對著我大喊。

Paul Anderson你因為在103年05月27日造訪新北市鶯歌博物館時，拿了原告陳小倩的雨傘，因為此行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，當你還傘時，當場被陳小倩人、傘具獲，因此她提出告訴。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎? 待會我也會詢問原告，聽聽她陳述當天發生的經過，雙方明白程序嗎?

The accused Paul Anderson, you have been prosecuted of theft case. On May 27th, 2018, you have visited Yingge Ceramics Museum, and you have taken the accuser Xiao-Chiang Chen’s umbrella without noticing her. When you returned the umbrella, the accuser has found you with her umbrella. Therefore, she has filed the case. Today’s procedure is to understand what has happened on that day, and I will ask a series of questions, please answer my questions so that we could understand the incident. Do you understand? Later. I will also ask the accuser to state the details of the incident. Do both parties understand the procedure?

column3: The word order in the sentence 'On May 27th, 2018, you have visited Yingge Ceramics Museum' is incorrect. It should be 'You visited Yingge Ceramics Museum on May 27th, 2018'.
The verb 'have taken' should agree with the subject 'you'. It should be 'you took'.
The verb 'have taken' should be in the past tense to match the time frame of the incident. It should be 'you took'.
The user's translation omits the information that the accused took the umbrella without noticing the accuser.

column1: 那請問被告103年5月27日下午4點15分時，你人在哪裡?
I would first like to ask the accused, where were you at 4:15 pm at May 27th, 2018.

column3: The user omitted the specific year (2018) and only mentioned the month and day.
The user placed the time phrase at the beginning of the sentence instead of after the verb 'were'.

column1: I was at Yingge Ceramics Museum.

column1: She yelled at me, saying that I stole her umbrella. I tried to tell her that I must have taken the wrong one. I did not steal her umbrella. I tried to apologize to her, but she wouldn’t listen.
他當時對我大叫，說我偷了他的傘，我跟他說我拿錯傘了，我並沒有想要偷竊的意思。我嘗試和他道歉，但他卻一直不聽。

column3: The word order in the sentence '他當時對我大叫' is incorrect. The correct word order should be '他當時對我大叫'.
The phrase '我跟他說我拿錯傘了' is a mismatched meaning. It should be translated as '我試著告訴她我可能拿錯了傘'.
The user's translation omits the important detail that the person being yelled at is a female. The correct translation should include the pronoun '她' to indicate the gender.

column1: 那為什麼陳小姐會說你偷了她的傘呢?

column3: The user's translation does not accurately convey the meaning of the original text.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
那天我和我的同學們去博物館看展覽。在展覽結束之後，我們當中的兩位同學肚子餓了，因此我們決定去外面尋找食物，順便去找晚餐的餐廳。在我離開的時候，我發現開始下雨了，因為我沒有帶傘，所以我決定和同學借傘。由於我比較高大，所以我決定和我的同學亞當借傘，因為我們的體型比較相似。我就從架上拿了一把雨傘，和教授還有其他學生們一起去買了些麵包。當我回來之後，陳小姐就對著我大叫。

column3: The user translated 'yell at' as '對著我大叫', which means 'yell at me', but the original text does not specify that Ms. Chen was yelling at the user specifically.

column1: Yes, I thought the umbrella I took belonged to Adam. I didn’t intend to steal anyone’s umbrella.

column3: The word 'steal' was translated as '偷' which means 'to steal' in Chinese, but in this context, it should be translated as '拿' which means 'to take'.

column1: Yes, when I came out from the museum, my professor and other two classmates were with me. My professor even offered to lend me her umbrella; since her umbrella was quite small, I didn’t take it. I didn’t want her to get wet. The other two classmates were there too.
是的，當我一走出陶瓷博物館之後，我的教授還有其他兩個學生都有看到。我的教授甚至問我需不需要借他的傘。但因為教授的傘太小了，我並沒有向他借傘，我不想要他淋濕。當時其他的兩位同學都在。

I tried to return Ms. Chen her umbrella but she wouldn’t take it. I tried to apologize to her but she wouldn’t listen to me, either. Perhaps my professor and my friends will be able to prove what I have said today is the truth.

column1: 好的，那我現在要詢問陳小姐，當天案發的經過。陳小姐，能否請你講述一下當天發生了什麼事。
Now I would like to ask the accuser Xiao-Chiang Chen some questions. Ms. Chen, can you stated what happened on that day?
我那天去鶯歌博物館，當時在下雨，我在進館時，把雨傘放在外面的傘架上，可是當我出來時，傘不見了，我請館方人員幫我找，後來就看到這個外國人把傘拿回來放，當我發現他拿的傘就是我失竊的傘時，我很生氣，有質問他為何要拿我的傘? 難道不知道外面在下雨嗎?怎麼會有人那麼沒有公德心呢?

I went to Yingge Museum at that day, and it was raining, so I put my umbrella in the rack. However, when I came out of the museum, I could not find my umbrella. I asked the museum staff to help me find my umbrella. After that, I saw a foreigner took my umbrella. When I realized that he took my umbrella, I was very angry, so I asked him “Do you know it is raining outside? Why did you take my umbrella? Don’t you have any sympathy?”

column3: The word order in the sentence 'I went to Yingge Museum at that day' is incorrect. It should be 'I went to Yingge Museum that day'.

The user's translation does not include the user's question about why the foreigner took the umbrella and their comment about the lack of sympathy.

column1: 新北市三峽區學府路132號5樓之4
25F.-4, No.132, Xuefu Rd., Sanxia Dist., New Taipei City
Paul Anderson你因為在103年05月27日造訪新北市鶯歌博物館時，拿了原告陳小倩的雨傘，因為此行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，當你還傘時，當場被陳小倩人、傘具獲，因此她提出告訴。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎? 待會我也會詢問原告，聽聽她陳述當天發生的經過，雙方明白程序嗎?

The defendant, Paul Anderson, you are prosecuted of a stealing case. The time was 5/27 in 2018. The location was Yingge Ceramics Museum. On that day, you took the accuser, Xiao-Qian, Chen’s umbrella. However, you didn’t tell him. After that, you turned back the umbrella. And Xiao-Qian, Chen found you and the umbrella. So, you are prosecuted. Today we are going to understand what happened on that day. So, please answer the question based on our question. Understand? Afterwards, I will also ask some questions for the accuser. So, do both parties understand the procedure?

column3: 拿了原告陳小倩的雨傘 (took the accuser, Xiao-Qian, Chen’s umbrella) should be translated as 借了原告陳小倩的雨傘 (borrowed the accuser, Xiao-Qian, Chen’s umbrella)
因為此行為發生在未告知原告的情況下 (because you didn’t tell him) is omitted in the translation

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.
那天，我去鶯歌陶瓷博物館看展覽，然後看完展覽之後，我跟我兩個同行的朋友就說肚子很餓，想要出去找一些食物吃，但是當我們要走出博物館的時候，才發現突然下雨了，但是我身上又沒有帶傘，然後打算向我朋友借一把，因為我身材比較高大，所以我決定跟我朋友亞當借傘，因為他身形跟我類似，於是，我就從傘架上拿了那一支傘，然後想說待會買一點東西，馬上就歸還，當我回到現場的時候，陳小姐就對著我吼叫。

column3: The word order in the sentence '然後看完展覽之後' is incorrect. It should be '然後我們看完展覽之後'.
The verb '說' should agree with the subject '我們', so it should be '我們說肚子很餓' instead of '我說肚子很餓'.
The verb '想要' should be in the past tense to match the context, so it should be '想要出去找一些食物吃' instead of '想要出去找一些食物吃'.
The pronoun '我們' is missing in the sentence '但是當要走出博物館的時候'. It should be '但是當我們要走出博物館的時候'.
The preposition '向' should be '跟' in the sentence '然後打算向我朋友借一把'. It should be '然後打算跟我朋友借一把'.
There should be a comma after '然後想說待會買一點東西' to separate it from the following clause.

column1: On that day, some classmates and I visited the Museum for an exhibition. When we finished viewing the exhibited items, two of my classmates said they were hungry. Therefore, we decided to go out and buy some food, perhaps even try to find a place for dinner. When I was leaving the museum, I realized it was raining. I didn’t bring an umbrella, so I planned to borrow one from my classmates. Because I am a bit tall and big, I decided to borrow the umbrella of Adam, a friend of mine. His body shape is similar to mine. Then I took one umbrella from the rack. I went to buy some bread with my professor and two other friends. When we came back, that’s when Ms. Chen started to yell at me.

column1: 被告是否了解以上權利？
Do you know the right you have?
Abus Gashion先生，你102年09月15日在桃園中正國際機場停車場，拿了機車車牌KB405上的一頂男用帽子，之後經受害者報案、警方調閱停車場的監視器紀錄，經身分確認後，了解該行為是你所為。由於該行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，又經受害者提出告訴，你涉嫌犯竊盜罪。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎?

Mr. Gashion, on the year one hundred and two, September 15th, you in the Taoyuan International Airport took the helmet from a motorcycle in the park lot and the number is KB405, did you do that? After that, the victim called the police. The police took the record from the park lot and they found that you did it. Because when you did that you didn’t tell the victim, so we accuse you have the case of theft. The procedure today is to know what happened that day. Please answer my question to help us to know what happened on that day, do you understand?

column1: 被告是否了解以上權利？
Do you understand the following statement?
Abus Gashion先生，你102年09月15日在桃園中正國際機場停車場，拿了機車車牌KB405上的一頂男用帽子，之後經受害者報案、警方調閱停車場的監視器紀錄，經身分確認後，了解該行為是你所為。由於該行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，又經受害者提出告訴，你涉嫌犯竊盜罪。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎?

Mr. Abus, in the one hundred and second year of Republic of China , September fifteenth, at the Taoyuan International Airport, did you take the helmet from the car KB-405? And the victim called the police. After polices took the investigation from videotape, they confirm that the person is you, Mr.Abus. Because you did not make any notification to the victim, you are violating the theft. The procession today is know what happen at that day. Please answer the question we have so that we can understand the situation, do you understand?

Abus Gashion先生，你102年09月15日在桃園中正國際機場停車場，拿了機車車牌KB405上的一頂男用帽子，之後經受害者報案、警方調閱停車場的監視器紀錄，經身分確認後，了解該行為是你所為。由於該行為發生在未告知原告的情況下，又經受害者提出告訴，你涉嫌犯竊盜罪。今天的程序主要是要了解那天發生了什麼事情，請就我提出的問題，加以回答，以便檢方了解當天的事發經過，了解嗎?

So, you had taken the helmet at the parking lot in Taoyuan International Airport. And the helmet is belong… belongs to the motorcycle which has the number is(of?) KB485.(記錯了) You did that behavior on September, 15th. And the victim went to the police. The police checked the recording and think that you had did that. Without the permission and the victim had gone to the police, so you had violent(violated) the theft. Today what we’re doing is want to know what had happened that day. Please answer the question(s) below to let me know the… what’s happening that day.

column1: I hope to be granted with the sole custody of my daughter because of two concerns. First, my wife no longer lives with us. I want to be there to see my daughter grow up. Moreover, I have heard that my wife is living with another man. If that is the case, I doubt it very much that she can give our daughter the best care she deserves. Therefore, I hope to have the sole custody.
我之所以希望能得到全部的撫養權有兩個原因。首先，我老婆不再與我們住在一起了，我希望能看著我小孩長大。再來，我聽說我老婆現在跟別的男人住在一起，如果真的是那樣的話，我很懷疑我女兒能得到全然的照顧。因此我希望擁有全部的撫養權。

column1: I have, on average, four to five part-time jobs. As a total, they will bring me about NT$50,000 per month. Sometimes, if I have new projects, I may be able to have more income.
我平均會有四到五個兼職，總共來說我大概會有五萬的收入。有時如果有另外的案子我可以有更多的收入。
另外我想要問的問題，是關於你有沒有可能在得到孩子撫養權後，把孩子帶回加拿大，就不回來了呢？我會這樣問，主要是因為，即使你拿到撫養權，你太太還是可能可以保有探視權，如果你把小孩子帶回你的國家，就會變成是變相的隔離她們母女見面。對這一點，你有什麼意見。

column1: I have stayed in Taiwan for five years already. I have an ARC and I like this place. So far, I don’t have any plan to leave Taiwan. During the entire period of our divorce case, I have regularly sent our daughter’s pictures to my wife. I even arranged outings to encourage her to spend time with us, me and our daughter.

column1: I hope to be granted with the sole custody of my daughter because of two concerns. First, my wife no longer lives with us. I want to be there to see my daughter grow up. column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. The adverbial phrase '是事實啦' should come after the subject '我'.

The user's translation omits the mention of having 'several' part-time jobs, which is an important detail in the original text.

column1: 你剛剛提到你目前有好幾份兼職工作，因為它們本身都是兼職的性質，你能夠保守估計自己每個月會有多少的固定收入嗎？

column3: The word order in the question is incorrect. It should be 'can you estimate how much money you are sure you can earn per month?'

column1: I have, on average, four to five part-time jobs. As a total, they will bring me about NT$50,000 per month. Sometimes, if I have new projects, I may be able to have more income.
我有四到五個打工的工作，平均來說。這大概可以讓我每個月賺五萬元左右吧。如果我有得到新的工作的話，也許這收入會更高。
另外我想要問的問題，是關於你有沒有可能在得到孩子撫養權後，把孩子帶回加拿大，就不回來了呢？我會這樣問，主要是因為，即使你拿到撫養權，你太太還是可能可以保有探視權，如果你把小孩子帶回你的國家，就會變成是變相的隔離她們母女見面。對這一點，你有什麼意見。

Moreover, I want to know that if you have the right to raise children; will you take your child back to Canada and you will not come back ever again? I would ask this question is because even if you do get the right to raise your children, your wife may still have the visitation right for your child. If you take your child back to Canada, it will transform into the separation of the mother and the child. What your opinion about this?

column3: The user omitted the mention of the possibility of the wife having visitation rights.
The user incorrectly translated '隔離她們母女見面' as 'separation of the mother and the child', which does not accurately convey the meaning of the original text.

column1: I have stayed in Taiwan for five years already. I have an ARC and I like this place. So far, I don’t have any plan to leave Taiwan. Especially, I believe that my daughter should have the opportunity to see both of her parents. I want to emphasize that although my wife and I are currently seeking a divorce, I have no intention of cutting the tie between her and my daughter. During the entire period of our divorce case, I have regularly sent our daughter’s pictures to my wife. I even arranged outings to encourage her to spend time with us, me and our daughter.
我已經在台灣住五年了。我不只有居留證我也很喜歡這裡。到目前為止，我沒有想要離開台灣的打算。而且我也認同我女兒必須要見到父母雙方。而且我也想要重申，即使我和我太太目前還在打離婚官司，我卻沒有想阻止她們母女倆互相見面的權利。就在我們還在打離婚官司時，我不時會寄我女兒的照片給太太，我還邀請我太太一起和我和女兒出去玩。

During the entire period of our divorce case, I have regularly sent our daughter’s pictures to my wife. I even arranged outings to encourage her to spend time with us, me and our daughter.

column1: I have stayed in Taiwan for five years already. I have an ARC and I like this place. So far, I don’t have any plan to leave Taiwan. I have, on average, four to five part-time jobs. As a total, they will bring me about NT$50,000 per month. Sometimes, if I have new projects, I may be able to have more income.

column1: 另外我想要問的問題，是關於你有沒有可能在得到孩子撫養權後，把孩子帶回加拿大，就不回來了呢？我會這樣問，主要是因為，即使你拿到撫養權，你太太還是可能可以保有探視權，如果你把小孩子帶回你的國家，就會變成是變相的隔離她們母女見面。對這一點，你有什麼意見。

If you bring your child back to Canada, you will become, to a degree, cut the tie between your wife and your child. To this, what’s your plea?

column1: I have stayed in Taiwan for five years already. I have an ARC and I like this place. So far, I don’t have any plan to leave Taiwan. Especially, I believe that my daughter should have the opportunity to see both of her parents. column1: I have stayed in Taiwan for five years already. I have an ARC and I like this place. So far, I don’t have any plan to leave Taiwan. Especially, I believe that my daughter should have the opportunity to see both of her parents. I want to emphasize that although my wife and I are currently seeking a divorce, I have no intention of cutting the tie between her and my daughter. I want to emphasize that although my wife and I are currently seeking a divorce, I have no intention of cutting the tie between her and my daughter. During the entire period of our divorce case, I have regularly sent our daughter’s pictures to my wife. I even arranged outings to encourage her to spend time with us, me and our daughter.

column1: I hope to be granted with the sole custody of my daughter because of two concerns. First, my wife no longer lives with us. I want to be there to see my daughter grow up. Moreover, I have heard that my wife is living with another man. If that is the case, I doubt it very much that she can give our daughter the best care she deserves. Therefore, I hope to have the sole custody.
我希望法院可以判給我全部撫養權，因為兩個原因。首先，我妻子不再跟我一起生活了。我想在這邊看我女兒長大。此外，我還聽說我妻子還跟另外一個男人共處。如果那是真的的話，我就懷疑她是否能撫養我們的女兒。所以我想要有全部的撫養權。

column3: Incorrect word order in the sentence '我希望法院可以判給我全部撫養權' (I hope the court can grant me full custody). The correct word order should be '我希望法院可以判給我全部撫養權'.
Subject-verb agreement error in the sentence '我想在這邊看我女兒長大' (I want to be there to see my daughter grow up). The correct verb form should be '我想在這邊看著我女兒長大'.

Mismatched meaning in the sentence '我還聽說我妻子還跟另外一個男人共處' (Moreover, I have heard that my wife is living with another man). The word '共處' (living together) does not accurately convey the meaning of 'living with' in this context. It should be translated as '和另外一個男人住在一起' (living together with another man).

Omission of the phrase 'the best care she deserves' in the sentence '我就懷疑她是否能撫養我們的女兒' (I doubt it very much that she can give our daughter the best care she deserves). The phrase 'the best care she deserves' is not included in the translation.

Addition of the word '全部' (full) in the sentence '我想要有全部的撫養權' (Therefore, I hope to have the sole custody). The word '全部' is not necessary and changes the meaning of the sentence. It should be translated as '我想要有獨自撫養的權利' (I hope to have the right to sole custody).

column3: The word order in the question is incorrect.

column1: 我兒子7歲了，我女兒8個月大。
My son is seven years old, and my daughter is eight months old.
那你搬出去住的時候，女兒是跟你、還是跟他？
After you move out, did your daughter live with you or your husband?

column3: The verb 'is' should agree with the subject 'daughter', so it should be 'is she' instead of 'is' alone.

column1: 因為我搬出去的時候，女兒只有2個月大，還很需要我的照顧，所以孩子跟我。
After I moved out, my daughter was just two months old, so she still needs me, and live with me.

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. It should be 'so she lives with me' instead of 'and live with me'.

column1: What about now? Who does the child live with

column3: The word order in the question is incorrect.

column1: 現在女兒在我先生那裏。
Now my daughter lives with my husband.

column3: The translation changes the meaning of the original text.

column1: 你們中間有什麼協議嗎，為什麼原來女兒跟你，現在跟他。
Did you have any agreement? Why did she live with you at first, and now with your husband?

column3: The user translated '協議' as 'agreement' instead of 'arrangement'.
The user placed the verb 'live' before the subject 'she' in the second sentence.
The user omitted the mention of the daughter in the second sentence.

column1: 我搬出來住的地方比較小，原來跟先生的房子比較大。環境上來說，對孩子比較優，所以我把孩子交給先生。
After I move out, I live in a smaller place, so my husband has a bigger place. The environment is better, so I think she’s better off with my husband.

column3: The user mistranslated '我把孩子交給先生' as 'I think she’s better off with my husband.' The correct translation is 'I entrusted the child to my husband.'

column1: 那如果客觀條件沒有改變的話，你的居住環境，對你女兒仍然比較不好，不是嗎？那為什麼會希望能夠爭取子女撫養權呢
Regardless of the objective circumstances, that’s still not…. Is that better for your daughter? So why do you want to get the sole custody of your daughter?

column3: The user's translation does not accurately convey the meaning of the original text.
The user's translation has incorrect word order.

column1: 她是我懷胎十個月生下來的阿，我怎麼捨得以後都看不到她呢？而且我先生是加拿大籍，他在台灣的工作也沒有很穩定，隨時有可能會回去加拿大，那這樣子的話，我不就見不到女兒了嗎？所以我希望能夠爭取女兒的撫養權。

After all, I’ve had her pregnant for ten months, she’s still my daughter. Besides, my husband is Canadian, and he doesn’t hold a stable job. In this concern, I may never see my daughter again. That’s why I want to get my daughter’s sole custody.

column3: The user omitted the mention of giving birth to the daughter.
The user used 'I’ve had her pregnant' instead of 'I carried her for ten months'.
The user translated '撫養權' as 'sole custody' instead of 'custody'.

column1: 就妳的經濟能力而言，你可以加以說明如何負擔女兒的撫養費用嗎？
As for your financial status, can you elaborate how are you going to raise your daughter?

column3: The user omitted the word 'ability' in the translation, which changes the meaning of the sentence.
The user switched the word order of 'financial' and 'status' in the translation.

column1: 我們目前還在打離婚官司，我希望能夠爭取到離婚之後能住在我先生現居的那棟房子裡，所以就環境來講，那棟房子會很適合我女兒成長。至於我個人的經濟能力，我有提供給法院一份目前我的財產表，除此之外，我也有固定的工作，一個月收入至少是4萬以上。我想我有能力撫養、照顧我的女兒。

So far, we’re still up with the divorce case. I’m fighting for the right to live in my husband’s place after the divorce case. Based on the environment, I think my husband’s place would be suitable for my daughter’s growing up. As for my financial status, I’ve provided an asset list for the court. And I also have a job with an income of 40000 NT a month. So I think I’m capable of raising my daughter.
請問你們目前的離婚案件進行地如何？有預定什麼時候判決會出來嗎？或是說，大概什麼時候判決會出來？
So may I ask how is your divorce case proceeding? Do you know when will the court’s decision be made?

column3: The word order in the question is incorrect. The correct word order should be: 'May I ask how your divorce case is proceeding?'
The user's translation omits the part 'Or is it possible to know roughly when the decision will be made?'

column1: 我不太確定，我們這個禮拜五還會再出庭一次，可是我希望能夠向離婚案件的法官表達，希望判決能夠盡快出來。
I’m not sure, we will be in another court this Friday. I will ask the judge of the divorce case to come up with a court decision as soon as possible.

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. It should be 'I will ask the judge of the divorce case to come up with a court decision as soon as possible.'

column1: 這樣好了，本院會安排社工人員造訪告訴人跟相對人雙方，並且針對你們與孩子的相處情況做出評估，本庭會參考他們的報告，來決定怎麼樣的安排對孩子是最好的。不過在那之前，想先請問一下，你們雙方會考慮共同持有撫養權嗎？所謂的共同撫養，是指孩子一段時間跟父親、另外一段時間跟母親。

How about we send a social worker to see both of you? So the social worker will make an evaluation based on how you interact with your daughter. We will take that evaluation as reference to see what works the best for your daughter. But before that, have you come to think about share custody? Basically, share custody is to have your daughter spend a certain amount of time with her father, and a certain amount of time with her mother.

column3: The word order in the sentence 'So the social worker will make an evaluation based on how you interact with your daughter' is incorrect. The correct word order should be 'So the social worker will make an evaluation based on how you interact with your daughter.'

The subject-verb agreement error is present in the sentence 'We will take that evaluation as reference to see what works the best for your daughter.' The correct form should be 'We will take that evaluation as a reference to see what works best for your daughter.'
The user's translation omits the mention of the social worker visiting both the '告訴人' and the '相對人'. The correct translation should include 'both of you' or 'both parties'.
The user's translation adds the phrase 'have you come to think about' which is not present in the original text. The correct translation should be 'will you consider' or 'have you considered'.

The user's translation does not accurately convey the meaning of '共同撫養'. Instead of using the term 'share custody', the user translates it as 'share custody'. The correct translation should be 'joint custody'.

column1: Personally, I do not favor this arrangement because my daughter is still too small. She is only 8 months old. I don’t want her to go through the changes between me and my wife. For a child at such a young age, it is too confusing for her if she has to stay with one parent for some time and another for another period of time.
我個人是不太贊同這種作法, 因為我女兒還太小, 她才八個月大, 我不希望她經歷我和我太太之間的流離失所, 對這麼小的小孩來說, 讓她以這種方式長大的話她會很困惑

column3: The user's translation does not accurately convey the meaning of 'changes between me and my wife' as '流離失所' (displacement) instead of '改變' (changes).

column1: 在這點上面，我同意我先生的看法。女兒還太小，不應該、也不適合共同撫養的安排方式。
On this point, I agree with my husband. Our daughter is too little, she’s not suitable for a share custody.

column3: The verb 'is' should agree with the singular subject 'daughter'.
The phrase 'she’s not suitable for a share custody' does not accurately convey the meaning of '女兒還太小，不應該、也不適合共同撫養的安排方式'.

column1: 既然如此，那麼我們就先進行社工探視的安排。等到他們做出報告，我們再安排庭期，讓雙方有陳述意見的機會。這樣可以嗎？
Ok, if that’s the case, we’ll first arrange a social worker to see how it goes. After there’s a result, we’ll arrange the next court time. And that both parties have the chance to elaborate.

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. The correct word order should be 'After there’s a result, we’ll first arrange a social worker to see how it goes.'
The user's translation omits the mention of a report being made by the social worker before arranging the next court time.
The user's translation does not include the mention of both parties having the opportunity to express their opinions.

column1: Yes, I am fine with social workers’ visits.
Ok, 我接受先讓社工來訪

column3: The word 'accept' was translated as '接受' which means 'to accept' in the sense of agreeing to something. However, in this context, 'accept' should be translated as 'fine with' or 'okay with'.

I am here today for child custody case, case number 2345 as an interpreter. I promise to faithfully and honestly interpret what is stated in this court. In the case of deliberately making false interpretation, the violation of perjury will apply.

column1: 今天我們進行Ferry Johnson與史彩雲之子女撫養權之準備程序。請問雙方都有請辯護人嗎？
Today, we are going to have a preparatory procedure for child custody of Mr. Ferry Johnson and Ms.史彩雲.Do you both have lawyers?

column1: 今天的準備程序中，我主要希望了解雙方在子女撫養權上的立場，也希望能夠知道為什麼你們各自認為自己比較適任撫養這個孩子。請就這一點特別的加以闡述，好嗎？此外，我知道你們這一件，也正在打離婚案件，所以希望雙方盡量不要發生在言語上攻擊對方的情況。了解嗎？

Today, we are going to understand your attitudes towards child custody.And the court also wants why you both think that you have the right to take care of this child.So please elaborate this point particularly.Besides, I know that you are now engaged in a divorce case.So please avoid any verbal attack, please.

column3: The word order in the sentence 'And the court also wants why you both think that you have the right to take care of this child' is incorrect. It should be 'And the court also wants to know why you both think that you have the right to take care of this child.'

The subject-verb agreement is incorrect in the sentence 'And the court also wants why you both think that you have the right to take care of this child.' It should be 'And the court also wants to know why you both think that you have the right to take care of this child.'
The user's translation omits the mention of the purpose of the court proceedings, which is to understand the parties' positions on child custody.
The user's translation omits the request for the parties to explain why they believe they are suitable for taking care of the child.
The user's translation omits the reminder to avoid verbal attacks due to the ongoing divorce case.

column1: 請問告訴人你為什麼希望能夠爭取孩子的撫養權？就我所知，你目前在台灣並沒有全職的工作，又因為你本人是外國人的身分，在爭取子女撫養權一事上，你為什麼認為你比較適任呢？

So first, I would like to ask the plaintiff some questions.The plaintiff, why do you want to be granted your child custody.As the court knows, you do not have a full-time job here in Taiwan.And you are a foreigner.On child custody, why do you think you have more custody than the other party?

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect.
The user's translation does not accurately convey the original meaning.
The user's translation omits important details from the original text.

column1: I hope to be granted with the sole custody of my daughter because of two concerns. First, my wife no longer lives with us. I want to be there to see my daughter grow up. Moreover, I have heard that my wife is living with another man. If that is the case, I doubt it very much that she can give our daughter the best care she deserves. Therefore, I hope to have the sole custody.
我想要得到我女兒的單獨撫養權有兩個原因。第一，我的太太不再跟我住在一起了。我希望我可以陪我女兒長大。而且我聽到，我太太和別的男人同居。如果真的是這樣的話，我很懷疑他是否可以提供我女兒應得的照顧。所以我想要爭取撫養權。

column3: Incorrect word order in the sentence '我想要得到我女兒的單獨撫養權有兩個原因' (I want to get sole custody of my daughter for two reasons). The correct word order should be '有兩個原因我想要得到我女兒的單獨撫養權' (For two reasons, I want to get sole custody of my daughter).

column1: 你的意思是說，因為你太太雖然目前還在跟你打離婚官司，可是她已經沒有跟你同住，而且你還懷疑她與其他男子同居。因為這種情況，你不願意把你們的孩子交給她照顧，是這樣子的嗎？

Do you mean that you are now engaged in a divorce case and you are no longer living together?And you doubt that your wife is living with another man.Because of the above-mentioned circumstances, you are unwilling to give your daughter to your wife, right?

column3: The word order in the sentence 'And you doubt that your wife is living with another man' is incorrect. It should be 'And you doubt that your wife is living with another man?'
The translation of '因為這種情況' as 'Because of the above-mentioned circumstances' is a mismatched meaning. It should be translated as 'Because of this situation'.
The translation omits the mention of the children in the sentence '你不願意把你們的孩子交給她照顧'. It should be translated as 'you are unwilling to give your children to her for care'.

column1: Yes, those are my main concerns.
是的，這就是我最擔心的原因。
另外，那麼對於你個人的經濟能力，也就是你如果能到子女撫養權，你打算要怎麼照顧你的女兒？
And regarding your financial status, if you are granted with your child’s sole custody, how can you take care of your daughter?

column3: The word order in the translation is incorrect.

column1: It is true that I don’t currently hold a full-time job. However, I have several part-time jobs which bring me a regular income. I believe that income will be sufficient for me to take care of myself and my daughter.
我現在的確沒有全職的工作。但是我有好幾份兼差，也是有固定收入的。我相信這些固定的收入可以讓我和我女兒好好地生活。

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. The correct word order should be '我現在的確沒有全職的工作。'

column1: 你剛剛提到你目前有好幾份兼職工作，因為它們本身都是兼職的性質，你能夠保守估計自己每個月會有多少的固定收入嗎？
You have mentioned that you have several part-time jobs at present.Because these jobs are just part-time, can you approximately estimate how much income is regularly?
I have, on average, four to five part-time jobs. As a total, they will bring me about NT$50,000 per month. Sometimes, if I have new projects, I may be able to have more income.
我平均都會有四五個兼差工作。所以我一個月大概都會有五萬塊台幣的收入。如果我有得到更多案子的話，我的收入就會增加。

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect.

column1: 另外我想要問的問題，是關於你有沒有可能在得到孩子撫養權後，把孩子帶回加拿大，就不回來了呢？我會這樣問，主要是因為，即使你拿到撫養權，你太太還是可能可以保有探視權，如果你把小孩子帶回你的國家，就會變成是變相的隔離她們母女見面。對這一點，你有什麼意見。

Is it possible that if you are granted with your child’s custody, you will go back to Canada and never come back again?The reason the courts asks so, even you are granted with the child custody, your wife can be granted with visitation right.If you brought your child back to Canada, it also made your daughter cut the tie with the mother. What’s your opinion to point?

column3: The user omitted the phrase 'The question I want to ask' at the beginning of the sentence.
The user placed the verb 'asks' before the subject 'the courts' instead of after it.
The user translated 'cut the tie' as '隔離' which means 'isolate' instead of '斷絕' which means 'sever' or 'cut off'.

column1: I have stayed in Taiwan for five years already. I have an ARC and I like this place. So far, I don’t have any plan to leave Taiwan. Especially, I believe that my daughter should have the opportunity to see both of her parents. I want to emphasize that although my wife and I are currently seeking a divorce, I have no intention of cutting the tie between her and my daughter. During the entire period of our divorce case, I have regularly sent our daughter’s pictures to my wife. I even arranged outings to encourage her to spend time with us, me and our daughter.
我已經在台灣住五年了。我得到了居留證，也很喜歡這裡。目前並沒有離開台灣的計劃。尤其我覺得我女兒應該要有見到他雙親的權利。我想要強調的是，雖然我和我太太正在打離婚官司，但我並沒有想要我女兒和我太太切斷聯繫。即使在我們的離婚訴訟進行中，我也是固定有寄我女兒的照片給我太太。我甚至安排了一些時間，邀請我太太和我女兒一起度過一些時光。

column3: The word order in the sentence '我女兒應該要有見到他雙親的權利' is incorrect. It should be '我女兒應該要有見到她雙親的權利'.

column1: 所以你的意思是指，在近期之內你並沒有返回母國的打算，是這樣嗎？
So, you mean that in a short time, you are not intended to go back to your homeland, right?

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. The correct word order should be 'So, you mean that you are not intended to go back to your homeland in a short time, right?'

column1: No, I may go back to Canada because my mother is old and sick. However, even if I go back, I wouldn’t stay long. I won’t even consider the possibility of taking my daughter with me.
是的，目前沒有這個計畫，但如果有一天我媽媽老了又生病的話。即使我回去，應該也不會待很久。我甚至也不會考慮帶我女兒一起回去。

column3: The verb tense in the translation is inconsistent with the original text. The original text uses the present tense ('my mother is old and sick'), while the translation uses the future tense ('如果有一天我媽媽老了又生病的話').
The word order in the translation is incorrect. The original text has 'I may go back to Canada', while the translation has '是的，目前沒有這個計畫' which means 'Yes, currently I don't have this plan'.

The translation omits the information that the speaker wouldn't consider taking their daughter with them. The original text explicitly states 'I won’t even consider the possibility of taking my daughter with me', but this information is not present in the translation.

column1: 今天我們進行外遇案件之準備程序。告訴人陳玉華提起這次的訴訟案件，主要是因為她的先生John Anderston跟所任職之補習班同事從往過密，且告訴人在其先生的手機簡訊記錄中查到一些親密訊息，再加上被告常常會藉故加班，或是深夜與其同事王彩燕進行視訊或其他方式之交談，因告訴人所蒐集之通訊內容已超過同事情誼，故提起此告訴。被告，你太太懷疑你有外遇，要告你通姦罪，你作何辯解？

Today we are here for the preparatory procedure for adultery. The plaintiff Yu-hua Chen filed the case of today. It’s mainly because her husband John Anderson has an intimate relation with one of the teacher in the cram school. The plaintiff found some intimate messages in her husband’s cellphone. Plus, the defendant usually tends to go home late and has close relation with Tsai Yen Wang in the cram school and even had video telephoning. The plaintiff found that everything proves that her husband and his coworker are actually beyond coworker’s relationship. That’s why the plaintiff filed this case. The defendant, your wife suspects you of committing adultery. What’s your plea?

column1: 今天我們進行外遇案件之準備程序。告訴人陳玉華提起這次的訴訟案件，主要是因為她的先生John Anderston跟所任職之補習班同事從往過密，且告訴人在其先生的手機簡訊記錄中查到一些親密訊息，再加上被告常常會藉故加班，或是深夜與其同事王彩燕進行視訊或其他方式之交談，因告訴人所蒐集之通訊內容已超過同事情誼，故提起此告訴。被告，你太太懷疑你有外遇，要告你通姦罪，你作何辯解？

Today is the preparation procedure for adultery case. The plaintiff, Chen Yu Hua, filed this case. The main reason the plaintiff file this case is that her husband has intimate relationships with his colleagues. The plaintiff found out some intimate message in her husband’s cellphone. In addition, her husband would find some reasons for working late and he would tele-conference with his colleague, Wang Chai Yu. The contents between her husband and his colleague collected by the plaintiff was too intimate, and it’s beyond the normal colleague relationship. Therefore, the plaintiff filed this case. Defendant, your wife doubt you that you have adultery with other women. What’s your plea?

column3: The verb 'is' should be in the past tense to match the time frame mentioned in the original text.

column1: 我們剛開始認識的時候，他是一位葡萄牙文老師，在我們結婚之後，他還有繼續教葡萄牙文，可是葡萄牙文在台灣並不是一個有很多人學的語言，所以他的授課時數一直很不穩定，有時候甚至一兩個月的課程都會是空窗期，後來因為希望能夠讓收入比較穩定，他想要開始教英文，可是因為他的母語並不是英文，所以他決定要去進修。

At first we met, he worked as a teacher who was teaching Portuguese.After he got married, he is still teaching PortugueseHowever, the Portuguese is … always not a popular language in Taiwan. Therefore, his teaching hours are always not very long.Sometimes … the period between jobs might be one month or two months.Later on, he hopes to have stable income. Therefore, he started to want to teach English.But English is not his mother tongue; he decided to seek an advanced degree.

column3: Incorrect word order in the sentence: 'At first we met, he worked as a teacher who was teaching Portuguese.'
The phrase 'the Portuguese is … always not a popular language in Taiwan' does not accurately convey the meaning of the original text.
The user's translation omits the information that the husband's teaching hours are unstable and sometimes there are gaps of one or two months between courses.
The user's translation includes the unnecessary information that the husband hopes to have stable income.
Incorrect word order in the sentence: 'Sometimes … the period between jobs might be one month or two months.'
The user's translation omits the information that the husband decided to seek an advanced degree in order to teach English.

column1: 你剛剛講到他決定要進修，是在台灣念一個學位嗎？
You mentioned that he wanted to seek an advanced degree. Did you mean that he wanted to study a diploma in Taiwan?

column3: The user incorrectly translated '進修' as 'diploma' instead of 'advanced degree'.

column1: 不是，因為他希望能夠在台灣教英文，所以必須取得的學位是關於英語教學的。他在網路上找到了一個美國加州所提供的遠距教學課程，讓他可以不用人去美國，都可以用函授的方式，完成課程的要求，這樣子在完成所有的學分之後，就可以取得碩士學位。他的計畫是，透過這樣子的一個美國學位，能夠在台灣找到英文教師的工作。

NoBecause he wanted to teach English in Taiwan, he needed to have a degree relating to English teaching.He found a program provided from the California online.  He didn’t have to go to America to learn the course. Instead, he can learn the course through on-line learning.If he finished all the courses required, he can have the degree.His plan is once he has the degree, he can apply for the jobs to teach English through this degree.

column3: Incorrect word order in the sentence 'NoBecause he wanted to teach English in Taiwan'
Omission of the word 'it' in the sentence 'He found a program provided from the California online.'
Omission of the word 'the' in the sentence 'He didn’t have to go to America to learn the course.'
Omission of the word 'the' in the sentence 'Instead, he can learn the course through on-line learning.'
Omission of the word 'the' in the sentence 'If he finished all the courses required, he can have the degree.'
Omission of the word 'a' in the sentence 'His plan is once he has the degree, he can apply for the jobs to teach English through this degree.'

column1: 那他跟這次所謂的外遇對象，是什麼樣的關係呢？
What is the relationship between him and his colleague?

column3: The word order in the question is incorrect.

column1: 他們是補習班的同事。那個補習班有安排所謂的中師跟外師搭檔教學。那個女的就是他班上的中師。
They are co-workers in the cram school.The cram school will have a Chinese teacher and a foreign teacher in the same class. And the woman is the Chinese teacher in his class.

column3: The user incorrectly translated '補習班' as 'cram school' instead of 'tutoring center'.

column1: minor categories of omission or addition
column3: The user omitted the information about the arrangement of the Chinese and foreign teachers in the same class.

column1: 你怎麼會知道他們有外遇呢？
How did you know he had an affair with her?

column3: The user translated '怎麼會知道' as 'How did you know' instead of 'How do you know'

column1: 一開始我只是注意到我先生常常會留在學校加班，我問過他好幾次，只不過是個美語補習班，有什麼好加班的？他告訴我說，因為要和中師搭檔教學，有很多需要溝通的地方。一開始我真的沒有懷疑他，可是我後來發現，他常常會在回家之後，接到一些電話，而接到電話的時候，都不會在我面前講，還會特地到書房去講。這讓我開始有所懷疑。所以我就查看了他的手機。

At first, I’m only aware of that he often stayed late in the cram school.I have asked him for many times that why you have to stay late in the cram school.He told me that because he has to work with the Chinese teacher, they have many things to discuss.At first, I didn’t doubt him.However, I found that he would receive some phone calls after he came home.And when he got the phone call, he will talk to the phone in his study instead of in front of me.This behavior made me doubt him. That is the reason why I started to check his cell phone.

column3: The user omitted the information that the husband is a teacher in a cram school.
The user used the incorrect verb form 'have' instead of 'has' to agree with the singular subject 'he'.
The user omitted the information that the husband receives phone calls after coming home.
The user omitted the information that the husband talks on the phone in the study instead of in front of the user.

column1: 在手機中你看到什麼不尋常的嗎？
In the cell phone, did you find anything special?
他的通訊紀錄中常常看到同一個電話號碼，所以我很好奇的又去查他的簡訊，查了之後才發現他跟一個女的幾乎每天都通簡訊。
In his phone book, there is a phone number called him often.I became curious so I checked his texts.After I checked, I found that he almost texted with another woman every day.

column3: The user used 'phone book' instead of 'communication records'.
The user omitted the information that the phone number appeared frequently in the communication records.
The user placed the verb 'called' before the subject 'him' instead of 'he called'.
The user translated '通訊紀錄' as 'phone book' instead of 'communication records'.
The user omitted the information that the user checked the texts out of curiosity.
The user omitted the information that the user found out that the person was texting with another woman.

column1: 就算是發簡訊，也還好吧？難道內容很不宜嗎？
Texting messages is fine, right? Is the content inappropriate?

column1: 如果只是普通的簡訊也就罷了，可是他是一個已婚的人，怎麼會讓對方發一些很親密的字句呢? 之前我有提供一些他們的簡訊內容給法院，應該都在卷夾裡面了。

If that is a normal text, that is OK.However, he is married, how could he text with another woman in such an intimate tone?I have provided some messages to the court. I believe you can see them in the file.

column1: 提示偵卷(一)第13頁。這邊裡面有幾通簡訊內容，請被告看一下。請問這是你手機上的簡訊內容嗎？
Please see the page 13 of investigatory file.Here are some messages. Defendant, please take a look.Are they the messages on your cell phone?
Yes, this is a message on my cell phone.
是，這些是我手機上的簡訊

column3: The word order in the translation is incorrect.

column1: 那我現在要針對這幾個內容跟你問一下，第一封是在中華民國101年11月31日21點50分，由手機0958-932***發送到你手機上的簡訊，內容是「I really miss you, my love」，請問這是什麼意思？
According these messages, I want to ask you some questions.The first message was texted at nine fifty pm on thirty first, November, 2012 from 0958-932*** The content is 我真的很想你，我的愛 What does it mean?

column3: The translation of 'I really miss you, my love' as '我真的很想你，我的愛' is accurate in terms of meaning, but the word choice for 'my love' could be improved. It is more common in Chinese to use '親愛的' (dear) instead of '我的愛' (my love) to address someone affectionately.

column1: Well, it’s from a colleague of mine. I remember, at that time, I took two days off from work. She was a bit concerned or worried. That’s why she sent me that message. My colleague was educated in the US and she is very open-minded. That’s the way she talked and expressed herself. As to “my love,” that is just a way we call the people we care.
這是我一個同事發的我記得那時候我休了兩天的假 她有點擔心我這也就是為什麼他會傳這封簡訊給我我的同事是在美國受教育，所以她的思想比較開放這是她說話的方式至於她稱呼我為我的愛，那只是一種我們之間的稱呼而已

column3: Misinterpretation of cultural reference

column1: 你是說，這個發信人因為之前在國外待過所以思想比較西化，對情感的表達也比較開放一點，所以「我的愛」並沒有什麼特別的意思，是嗎？
You mean that because the person who text you is educated in the United States, she is westernized.And the way she expressed herself is more openSo “my love” doesn’t mean anything special, right?

column3: The user misinterprets the cultural reference of 'my love' and assumes it doesn't have any special meaning.

column1: No, that is a very common expression between good friends or friends who care a lot for each other.
當然，這只是一種表達關心的方式而已，只代表我們很關心彼此

column2: failing to adapt idiomatic expressions to the target language
column3: The user's translation does not accurately convey the idiomatic expression 'between good friends or friends who care a lot for each other.'
The user omitted the previous statement in their translation.

column1: As I said, she was worried about me. We are partners at work. When I was away for two days, she naturally missed me.
就如同我之前說的，她非常擔心我，我們是工作上的同事 當我不在工作崗位上兩天，她當然會想我啊

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. The subject and verb should be reversed.

column1: 你的意思是，對方只是因為你兩天沒有上班，才發這樣的簡訊，因為沒有你上課的輔助，所以她很想你？就只是這樣子嗎？
You mean the person texts you because you have two days off.Because she didn’t have your help in the class, she missed you?That’s all?

column3: The user's translation misinterprets the original text by suggesting that the person texts the speaker because they have two days off, rather than the original meaning of the person texting because the speaker didn't provide assistance in class.

column1: Yes, that was the context. The message was no big deal
對，當時的背景就是這樣，這封簡訊沒什麼

column3: The user omitted the important detail that the message was a text message.

column1: 那第二封簡訊，是在中華民國102年1月13日23點55分，也是由同一個人的手機發送給你，訊息內容是「I want you by my side, when can we be truly together?」，請問這句話是什麼意思，為什麼會有這樣的內容呢？

The second message sent at eleven fifty fife p.m. on thirteenth, January, 2013 from the same phone number mentioned above.The content of the message is 我希望你可以在我身邊，什麼時候我們才可以在一起呢?What does this message mean? What did she send you this kind if message?

column3: The translation does not accurately convey the meaning of the original message.

You mean that she texted you this message to help you with your assignment?

column3: The user's translation does not accurately convey the meaning of the original text.

column1: As my wife has informed the court. I was attending a Master’s program. In that program, I was required to complete 30 credits before I could receive my degree. Naturally, I needed to complete some assignments and exercises.
就像我之前講的，我正在進修碩士學程在這個學程，我被要求要修滿三十學分，才可以取得這個學位很自然地，我就有一些作業和練習要做啊

column3: The word order in the sentence is incorrect. The verb '講' (speak) should come after the subject '我' (I).
The user's translation omits the mention of 'my wife informing the court' in the original text.
The user's translation leaves out the mention of 'assignments and exercises' in the original text.

column1: 先請你解釋一下，你的碩士學位到底在念什麼？

column1: My program was TESOL. In that program, some of the courses were related to English teaching and others were related to culture and language competence.
我的學位名稱是英語教學在這個學程裡面，主要的課程有關於英語教學，其他則關於文化還有語言能力方面的課程

column3: The word 'program' is translated as '學位名稱' which means 'degree name' instead of '學程' which means 'program'.
The word 'TESOL' is translated as '英語教學' which means 'English teaching' instead of 'TESOL' which is an acronym for 'Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages'.
The word order in the sentence is incorrect. It should be '在這個學程裡面，主要的課程有關於英語教學，其他則關於文化還有語言能力方面的課程'.
The user's translation omits the mention of 'some of the courses' in the original text.

So you are seeking a degree about English teaching, but there are some courses about culture and language competence.

column1: Yes, I remember at least three courses were related to culture and communication.
是，我記得至少有三個課程和文化與溝通有關

column1: The assignments for the culture and communication courses can be different for every student. Take myself for example. I am in Taiwan and try to seek a teaching position as an English teacher. To reach this goal and prove my competence, I have to show that I have a good command of Chinese. Therefore, many of my assignments were about Chinese-English sentence translation.
語言與文化課程的作業可能會因同學而異就舉我為例子我是一個希望在台灣能取得教師資格的人為了要達成這個目的，我必須要證明我在使用中文上很有能力因此，大部分我的作業是有關中英的翻譯

column1: 你是說因為你計畫在台灣教英文，所以這個碩士課程的內容就要求你證明自己有一定的中文能力。所以你必須完成課程中所給的一些作業，作業的練習就是翻譯句子，是這樣的嗎？

Because you planned to teach English in Taiwan, the course required you to prove that you have the competence in dominating Chinese.So you have to complete the assignments given by the course and they are about translating sentences

column3: The user omitted the mention of the specific assignments given by the course.
The user used the phrase 'competence in dominating Chinese' instead of 'competence in speaking Chinese', resulting in a subject-verb agreement error.

column1: True. Of course, I was also required to sharpen my speaking and writing skills.

So back to the message. You said that it is your assignment, right?

column1: Yes, I remember that sentence. When I got the Chinese sentences, I didn’t know how to say them in English. You know, some Chinese words can be very difficult for foreigners to recognize. I needed some help so I asked my colleague to help me. I told her to translate that sentence for me and sent me the answer.
對，我還記得這個句子當我拿這個中文句子的時候，我不知道怎麼把它翻成英文你知道，有些中文字對外國人來說總是比較難了解我需要一些幫助，所以我向我的同事請求幫助我請她幫我翻這個句子，然後將答案用簡訊傳給我

column2: failing to adapt idiomatic expressions to the target language

You mean you asked how to translate the sentence to your colleague and she sent the answer to you through texts, right?That is to say, the text is only an answer for an assignment.

column1: 那再提示偵卷(一)第14到16業的所有簡訊內容，這些請你看一下，都是你因為要做作業，尋求對方幫助，對方才發給你的簡訊嗎？

Yes, all these messages were for the same purpose of completing my assignments.
對，這些簡訊的功用都是為了幫助我完成作業

column1: My wife really thinks too much of this matter. I know she is not satisfied with my ability of supporting the family. I want the court to know that she, from the very beginning of my study, has never shown any support. She was not willing to help me complete my degree. If she had been a bit more supportive, I would not have asked my colleague to help me. I think she should be blamed for all this misunderstanding.
我太太對這件事情真的是想太多了我知道她對我的養家能力非常不滿我希望庭上可以知道，在我在進修的時候，她從來沒有提供任何幫助給我她很不願意幫助我完成我的進修學業如果她有願意幫忙的話，我就沒有必要我問同事了我認為她要為這些誤解負責

column1: 根據你的說法，你們夫妻之間似乎有些相處不愉快的情況？
According to your responses, it seems that there are some problems between you and your wife.

At the beginning of our marriage, we did have some good time. But the problem is my employment. I tried teaching Portuguese in Taiwan but could not get stable teaching hours. Then my job became the issue between the two of us. We fought from time to time over this issue. She didn’t believe that I have tried my best, and I have no way to let her understand my frustration and the difficult situation I have faced.
我們剛結婚的時候，我們的確過得很開心但我的就業卻是個問題我嘗試在台灣教葡萄牙語，但是卻沒有辦法有很穩定的工作時數所以我的工作就變成我們兩個之間很大的問題我們常常為這件事情吵架她並不相信我已經盡力了 她完全沒辦法理解我遇到的困難和挫折

column3: Incorrect word order in the sentence '我們的確過得很開心但我的就業卻是個問題' (We did have some good time, but my employment is a problem).
Subject-verb agreement error in the sentence '我們常常為這件事情吵架' (We fought from time to time over this issue). The verb '吵架' (fought) should agree with the subject '我們' (we) in number.

Mismatched meaning in the sentence '她完全沒辦法理解我遇到的困難和挫折' (She completely can't understand the difficulties and frustrations I have faced). The word '完全' (completely) is not necessary and changes the meaning of the sentence.

column1: 好，那回到你剛剛所講的碩士課程。請問你碩士課程是什麼時候開始的，結束了嗎？你拿到學位了嗎？
Let’s go back to the Master degree course you just mentioned.When did you begin the course of the Master degree?

column3: The word order in the question is incorrect.

column1: I first started the program in Spring 2010. It was a two-year program. I should have finished the program in December 2012. I didn’t finish the program because I was working part-time and didn’t get enough time to do my course assignments. Like I said, my wife has never been very supportive. I felt that I was pursuing the degree all alone by myself. I became too tired and too frustrated.
我在2010年春季的時候開始上課的她是一個兩年的課程我應該要在2012年12月的時候完成這課程但是我並沒有完成這個學業，因為我有兼職工作，造成我沒有時間完成我的作業如同我之前所說的，我老婆並不很支持我我覺我是一個人孤軍奮戰地追求這個學業我感到很累而且很挫折

column3: The translation does not accurately convey the meaning of the original message.

column1: Well, it’s from a colleague of mine. I remember, at that time, I took two days off from work. She was a bit concerned or worried. That’s why she sent me that message. My colleague was educated in the US and she is very open-minded. That’s the way she talked and expressed herself. As to “my love,” that is just a way we call the people we care.
是我同事傳來的。我記得那時候我請了兩天假，他有點擔心。也就是為甚麼他傳這封簡訊給我，他在美國接受教育，所以她比較開放。這就是他講話的方式，至於我所說的「愛」，這就是我們關心別人的方式。

column3: Misinterpretation of cultural references or symbols

column1: 你是說，這個發信人因為之前在國外待過所以思想比較西化，對情感的表達也比較開放一點，所以「我的愛」並沒有什麼特別的意思，是嗎？

Do you mean that the message sender was educated in the states, so her ideas were quite westernized. Then she was quite open-minded about expressing her love. So the word “our love” doesn’t mean too much. Is that right?

column1: No, that is a very common expression between good friends or friends who care a lot for each other.

There is a pronoun error in the sentence '我不知道要怎麼跟她說我的挫折'. The pronoun '我的' should be '我' to maintain consistency with the previous pronoun usage.

column1: 被告是否了解以上權利？

今天我們進行外遇案件之準備程序。告訴人陳玉華提起這次的訴訟案件，主要是因為她的先生John Anderston跟所任職之補習班同事從往過密，且告訴人在其先生的手機簡訊記錄中查到一些親密訊息，再加上被告常常會藉故加班，或是深夜與其同事王彩燕進行視訊或其他方式之交談，因告訴人所蒐集之通訊內容已超過同事情誼，故提起此告訴。被告，你太太懷疑你有外遇，要告你通姦罪，你作何辯解？

Today we are here for the preparation procedure of adultery. The plaintiff, Yu Hua Chen, filed this case. The plaintiff suspect her husband, John Anderston, has a beyond co-worker’s relation with his co-worker of the cram school, and the plaintiff found some intimate messages in the defendant’s cell phone. In addition, the defendant will always make up reasons for going out in the with Wang Cai Yan and also has the tele-conference with her in the midnight. According to the information found by the plaintiff, she found that their relationship is beyond co-worker’s relationship. Therefore, she filed for this case. Defendant, your wife suspected you are having an affair with another, and she filed for the case of adultery.

column1: 一開始我只是注意到我先生常常會留在學校加班，我問過他好幾次，只不過是個美語補習班，有什麼好加班的？他告訴我說，因為要和中師搭檔教學，有很多需要溝通的地方。一開始我真的沒有懷疑他，可是我後來發現，他常常會在回家之後，接到一些電話，而接到電話的時候，都不會在我面前講，還會特地到書房去講。這讓我開始有所懷疑。所以我就查看了他的手機。

At first, I did not suspect he is having an affair with her. But after a while, I noticed that, my husband would get some phone calls after he came home. When he received those phone calls, he did not speak the phone directly in front of me, instead going to the study room. That is the reason why I checked the information in his cell phone.

column1: 那請問被告，有沒有任何希望法庭為你調查的事證？現在的情況是，你的碩士學位早就已經在中華民國101年12月05日結束，實在沒有理由以做作業為藉口來解釋你跟王彩燕的簡訊互動，尤其是你們的簡訊互動大多在晚上九點鐘以後進行，實在起人疑竇，你有沒有任何證據，可以幫助自己的案情呢？
